entries.title: Judge: Colorado supermarket shooting suspect unfit to stand trial
entries.description: The 23-year-old alleged attacker is charged with killing 10 people in a Colorado supermarket in March 2021.

entries.title: BBC Arabic radio goes off air after 85 years
entries.description: The Arabic language radio station is among 10 different language services that are ending, BBC says.

entries.title: Thapelo Amad elected first Muslim mayor of Johannesburg
entries.description: Amad says he is 'humbled' to be elected mayor of the South Africa's biggest metropolis.

entries.title: What does Blinken’s Middle East visit hope to achieve?
entries.description: The trip comes at a time of increasing tension with dozens of Palestinians killed by Israeli forces so far this year.

entries.title: Quran burned in front of Denmark mosque, Turkish embassy
entries.description: Turkey summons Danish ambassador after a far-right politician burns the Muslim holy book near a Copenhagen mosque.

entries.title: M23 rebels take control of Kitshanga in eastern DR Congo
entries.description: The rebels seize the strategic town after days of fierce fighting, drawing condemnation from the UN.

entries.title: US charges three in Iran-linked plot to assassinate journalist
entries.description: Attorney General Garland says charges stem from an investigation into Iranian efforts to target a journalist on US soil.

entries.title: Peru’s president says elections could be held later this year
entries.description: Dina Boluarte says she is open to bringing vote forward to December 2023 as protests demanding her resignation continue.

entries.title: Gunman kills at least 5 people in East Jerusalem attack
entries.description: Shooting follows a deadly Israeli raid in the occupied West Bank's Jenin refugee camp that killed nine Palestinians.

entries.title: US inflation and consumer spending cooled in December
entries.description: The pullback in consumer spending will likely be welcomed by Fed officials, who are seeking to cool the economy.

entries.title: Majida Obaid, killed by Israeli forces in Jenin, was ‘very loved’
entries.description: The 61-year-old grandmother among nine who were shot dead by Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank city of Jenin.

entries.title: Footage released of hammer attack on Nancy Pelosi’s husband
entries.description: Police video shows Paul Pelosi, husband of former US House Speaker, attacked with a hammer in their San Francisco home.

entries.title: Zimbabwe court grants bail to 26 opposition party members
entries.description: The arrests of the CCC members were for what authorities said was an unlawful gathering.

entries.title: Nepal Supreme Court removes deputy PM over citizenship
entries.description: Rabi Lamichhane, who entered politics on an anti-corruption platform, is removed for violating citizenship laws.

entries.title: India’s Adani Group loses $48bn in stocks over fraud claims
entries.description: Hindenburg Research claimed Adani Group had committed 'brazen' corporate fraud but Adani Group dismissed the report.

entries.title: Tyre Nichols: US braces for release of police arrest video
entries.description: Memphis police chief says the video, which shows police beating a Black motorist, depicts 'acts that defy humanity'.

entries.title: Biden names Jeff Zients as new White House chief of staff
entries.description: Shake-up comes midway through US president's term, as outgoing Ron Klain resigns citing need for 'fresh leadership'.

entries.title: UNICEF urges release of 13 kidnapped children in eastern DRC
entries.description: The ADF, a central African affiliate of ISIL, is one of the deadliest armed groups in eastern DRC.

entries.title: OPCW blames Syria gov’t for 2018 chlorine gas attack in Douma
entries.description: OPCW says helicopter dropped two cylinders 'containing toxic chlorine gas on two apartment buildings' in Douma.

entries.title: Finnish reporters found guilty of revealing classified intel
entries.description: Press freedom groups, Finnish media warn ruling could have a chilling effect on reporting in the Nordic nation.

entries.title: After Jenin, is a third Palestinian uprising inevitable?
entries.description: Israel's military raid in Jenin was the deadliest in years, and makes an uprising more likely.

entries.title: Rockets, air attacks in Gaza follow deadly Israeli raid in Jenin
entries.description: Operation in occupied West Bank generates defiance in Gaza, but could it lead to another war?

entries.title: State of emergency declared in Auckland after widespread flooding
entries.description: Main roads were also blocked by the floods, causing long traffic queues on highways.

entries.title: Ukraine warns it may boycott 2024 Olympics if Russians take part
entries.description: The IOC has said it will 'explore a pathway' for Russian and Belarusian athletes to take part in the Paris Games.

entries.title: Nigeria launches domestic card scheme to boost cashless economy
entries.description: The move is part of the central bank's moves to reduce cash flow within the borders of Africa's biggest economy.

entries.title: Staying warm this winter: How cold affects those most vulnerable
entries.description: Extreme cold, high inflation and spiralling energy costs are affecting every aspect of American life.

entries.title: Islamophobia makes democracies less safe for everyone
entries.description: Islamophobic acts have an effect not only on Muslims but the entire society in which they occur.

entries.title: What do we know about Tyre Nichols’s killing by Memphis police?
entries.description: Five police officers have been charged with the murder of 29-year-old Tyre Nichols.

entries.title: Malaysia condemns desecration of Quran in Netherlands, Sweden
entries.description: Kuala Lumpur says it is 'appalled' that Islamophobic acts had been repeated within days in the two European countries.

entries.title: Toxic chemicals allegedly kill 18 people in Pakistan’s Karachi
entries.description: At least 18 people, most of them children, die within 16 days as residents report foul smell from two factories.

entries.title: Knowing when to quit is an important part of being a good leader
entries.description: Uganda's Yoweri Museveni and Cameroon's Paul Biya have a lot to learn from New Zealand’s Jacinda Ardern.

entries.title: UN condemns M23 rebel offensive on DRC town as hundreds flee
entries.description: The M23 rebels have seized areas of eastern DRC's North Kivu province in a rapid onslaught since May.

entries.title: US military operation kills top ISIL leader in Somalia
entries.description: The US said the operation was carried out on January 25 on al-Sudani, 'a key facilitator for ISIS’s global network'.

entries.title: ‘Oldest and most complete’ mummy found in Egypt
entries.description: The 4,300-year-old mummy was found covered in layers of gold near the Step Pyramid at Saqqara.

entries.title: Are humans fundamentally decent?
entries.description: 'Most people deep down are pretty decent but power corrupts,' argues historian and author Rutger Bregman.

entries.title: ‘Happy tears’ as Sania Mirza bows out of Australian Open
entries.description: Mirza played her last Grand Slam match where she and her partner Bopanna lost the Australian Open mixed doubles final.

entries.title: Russia’s FM Lavrov meets Eritrean president on Africa tour
entries.description: Foreign minister's trip to Eritrea comes as part of his Africa tour which took him to South Africa, Angola and Eswatini.

entries.title: One person killed in armed attack on Azerbaijan embassy in Iran
entries.description: Azerbaijani foreign ministry say a guard has been killed in the attack.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 338
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 338th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Japan, Netherlands to join US in China chip controls: Bloomberg
entries.description: Agreement on tighter export controls on China would be seen as a big diplomatic win for US President Joe Biden.

entries.title: Gandhi’s killer Godse ‘real patriot’ for some Hindu nationalists
entries.description: Many visit temple near New Delhi dedicated to Nathuram Godse, who on January 30, 1948 gunned down the freedom fighter.

entries.title: IAEA reports blasts near Zaporizhzhia plant, Russia rejects claim
entries.description: The International Atomic Energy Agency reported explosions near the Ukrainian nuclear power plant occupied by Russia.

entries.title: Fiji suspends police commissioner, ends China policing agreement
entries.description: Commissioner of Police Sitiveni Qiliho is seen as close to former Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama.

entries.title: Israel air attacks hit Gaza after 10 Palestinians killed in Jenin
entries.description: Witnesses reported Israeli drones firing missiles at targets in Gaza followed by fighter jets attacking locations.

entries.title: Myanmar military announces strict new election law ahead of polls
entries.description: New rules, published in state media, appear designed to ensure there is no meaningful opposition to the military.

entries.title: Japan tightens Russia sanctions, expands export ban list
entries.description: Tokyo's latest sanctions come after Russia launched missile attacks across Ukraine that killed at least 11 people.

entries.title: South Korea’s unions cry ‘red scare’ amid North Korea spy claims
entries.description: South Korea's spy agency has accused members of the country's largest union of illegally contacting North Korean agents.

entries.title: ICC to resume investigation into Philippines’s deadly drug war
entries.description: Manila had argued it was conducting its own investigation into deaths under the controversial policy.
